channel.title: Richard Brody: Movie News and Reviews
channel.description: The New Yorker's Richard Brody discusses blockbuster movies, independent films, and documentaries.

item.title: The Experimental High Notes of “Hale County This Morning, This Evening”
item.description: Richard Brody reviews “Hale County This Morning, This Evening,” filmed by RaMell Ross in rural Alabama.
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: Highlights from BAMcinemaFest
item.description: Richard Brody on the movies being shown at BAMcinemaFest, which begins on Wednesday night.
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: Review: The Authoritarian Populism of “Incredibles 2”
item.description: Richard Brody reviews the new Pixar film “Incredibles 2,” directed by Brad Bird, which he argues promotes “superhero essentialism.”
item.media:keywords: Movie Reviews, The Incredibles, Superheroes, Populism, Politics
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: What to Stream This Weekend: How to Find Good Movies on Netflix
item.description: Richard Brody recommends movies to stream on Netflix, including “Son of Joseph,” “Planetarium,” “Strong Island,” and more.
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: “Superfly,” Reviewed: A Classic Remade for a Gun-Mad Age
item.description: Richard Brody reviews Director X’s reënvisioned “Super Fly,” from 1972, depicting the same criminal with peaceful dreams, but the experience of watching these movies is as different as night and day.
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: “Nancy” Reviewed: A Complex, Untapped Story of a Woman’s Desperate Hoax
item.description: Richard Brody on the film “Nancy,” directed by Christina Choe and starring Andrea Riseborough.
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: In “Not a Pretty Picture,” Two Rape Victims Collaborate to Restage an Assault
item.description: Richard Brody reviews “Not a Pretty Picture,” a documentary film by Martha Coolidge playing in Anthology Film Archives’ series “Documentarists for a Day.”
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: What to Stream This Weekend: Four American Independent Films Among the Many Treasures on Kanopy
item.description: Richard Brody recommends independent films available on the streaming service Kanopy, including “The Arbalest,” “Illusions,” and “In Jackson Heights.”
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: “Ocean’s 8” Isn’t Up to the Talents of Its Stars
item.description: Richard Brody reviews “Ocean’s 8,” which stars Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Rihanna, Anne Hathaway, and others in a gender-swapped reboot of “Ocean’s Eleven.”
item.media:keywords: Movies, Movie Reviews, Sandra Bullock, Rihanna, Anne Hathaway
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody

item.title: “Upgrade,” Reviewed: The Misguided Nostalgia Behind a Low-Budget Sci-Fi Horror Film
item.description: Richard Brody reviews the new sci-fi horror film “Upgrade,” starring Logan Marshall-Green and directed by Leigh Whannell.
item.dc:creator: Richard Brody
